items.content: Basisstof
Extra oefeningen

Translate

Penitentiaire inrichting

Een gevangenis wordt ook wel een penitentiaire inrichting genoemd. Als je bent veroordeeld en je moet zitten, dan word je op de dag van je aankomst gecontroleerd. Dit betekent dat je uit de kleren moet. Je kleding wordt goed onderzocht op bezittingen. Ook wordt je urine gecontroleerd. In Nederland gebeurt dit op een humane wijze. Daarna krijg je een intakegesprek en word je door een medewerker naar je cel gebracht. De mannen en vrouwen zitten gescheiden. Je wordt dus naar een afdeling gebracht die uitsluitend voor mannen of voor vrouwen is.

bron: http://mens-en-samenleving.infonu.nl/diversen/90886-leven-in-de-gevangenis.html

Finished? Find yourself an interesting English article in which you find more information about prisons (or any crime & justice related article) and prepare a one minute speech!
Verdieping
Basisstof
Extra oefeningen

prompt.body:
1. Wat voor dorpje is Red Bluff?

  2. Wat hield de politie achter voor de media?

  3. Wat miste er op de crime scene?

  4. Wat vond de school waar Dave elke donderdag kwam van hem?

  5. Dave was een goeie vent zonder problemen. Waarom was dat niet alleen maar goed voor de politie?

  6. Wat voor angstaanjagende gedachte komt er voort uit het lezen van een ochtendkrant?

  7. Waarom is de moordenaar geen sniper?

  8. Waarom zou het ook een mede politie agent kunnen zijn?

  9. Wat voor mening heeft de moordenaar?

  10. Wie is de advocaat van Andrew?

  11. Wat is er nu echt gebeurd die bewuste avond?

  12. Waarom hadden de kinderen speelkaarten van de politie?

items.content: Verdieping
Basisstof
Extra oefeningen

SUSPECT INTERROGATION

1. I once ate 15 eggs in 5 minutes.

2. I sometimes help my dad counting bats.

3. My brother caught a thief by using a candid camera.

1. My parents met each other while writing letters when my father was a soldier.

2. I volunteered in Africa in the slumps for 3 months.

3. I found a fly in my pork tenderloin but the waiter didn't believe it was already in it.

1. My best friend was kidnapped for a couple of hours when she was 8 years old.

2. I neglected my hamster and after a while it was not able to walk anymore.

3. When I was in grade 7 I had to take typing lessons, but I was so sick and tired of it that I threw my typing machine out of the window once.

Well, a lot of weird stories. 1 out of every 3 is true. You should interrogate me in order to find out which one is true. Of course I will not confess so you have to ask difficult questions or pay attention to my body language as well.

Good luck, I'm a good liar.
Verdieping

ALIBI

Last Friday night a bank was robbed (=passive ;)). The suspects are 5 people of this class, but they claim they have an alibi: they went eating at a restaurant far away from the crime scene.

What to do?

- The 5 suspects prepare their story. (Make sure you know every detail of the story!)

- The rest of the class will be divided in 5 groups and they prepare their interrogation. (Make sure you ask questions that will 'trick' the suspects!)
Basisstof
Extra oefeningen

PENPAL PRISONERS

In the USA many people write to prisoners (US: inmate). What reasons do you think they have for doing that?

You are also going to write a letter to a pen pal.

Havo: use at least 1 passive and underline the sentence.

VWO: use at least 5 different types of passives and underline the sentences.

After writing, exchange your letters with a neighbour and correct his/her work. Do this twice

(so correct 2 letters and yours will be corrected twice as well).
Verdieping
Basisstof
Extra oefeningen
Verdieping

Diagnostische toets

Sentences are given in the active voice. Change them into the passive voice.

1. He teaches English.

2. The child is eating bananas.

3. She is writing a letter.

4. The master punished the servant.

5. He was writing a book.

6. Who wrote this letter?

7. Somebody cooks meal every day.

8. He wore a blue shirt.

9. May God bless you with happiness!

10. They are building a house.

11. I have finished the job.

12. I sent the report yesterday.

13. She bought a diamond necklace.

14. Somebody had stolen my purse.

Answers

1. English is taught by him.

2. Bananas are being eaten by the child.

3. A letter is being written by her.

4. The servant was punished by the master.

5. A book was being written by him.

6. By whom was this letter written?

7. Meal is cooked by someone every day.

8. A blue shirt was worn by him.

9. May you be blessed with happiness!

10. A house is being built by them.

11. The job has been finished by me.

12. The report was sent yesterday.

13. A diamond necklace was bought by her.

14. My purse had been stolen by somebody.
Basisstof
Go to http://www.wrts.nl/studiovoengels and open the lists Crime & Justice. Make sure you do all lists (EN-NE and NE-EN).

heading.content: Alle theorie van dit thema op een rij

items.content:
Passive voice

The form

The Passive Voice is formed by: Subject + finite form of to be + Past Participle.
Example: A letter was written.

When rewriting active sentences in the passive voice, note the following:

  • The object of the active sentence becomes the subject of the passive sentence.
  • The finite form of the verb is changed (a finite form of to be + Past Participle).
  • The subject of the active sentence is preceeded by the preposition 'by' (or is dropped).

Note the differences between Dutch and English:

Dutch English
o.t.t. Het boek wordt gelezen present simple The book is read
o.v.t. Het boek werd gelezen past simple The book was read
v.t.t. Het boek is gelezen present perfect The book has been read
v.v.t. Het boek was gelezen past perfect

The book had been read

The use

Passive voice is used when the focus is on the action.
It is not important or not known, however, who or what is performing the action.

Example: My bike was stolen.
In the example above, the focus is on the fact that my bike was stolen.
I do not know, however, who did it.

Sometimes a statement in the passive voice is more polite than the active voice,
as the following example shows:

Example: A mistake was made.
In this case, I focus on the fact that a mistake was made, but I do not blame anyone
(e.g. You have made a mistake.).

The examples

Tense Subject Verbs (prepositional) Object
Simple Present Active: Rita writes a letter
Let op: bij I gebruik 'am', bij he/she/it gebruik 'is', bij de rest gebruik 'are' Passive: A letter is written by Rita
Simple Past Active: Rita wrote a letter
Let op: bij I/he/she/it gebruik 'was', bij de rest gebruik 'were' Passive: A letter was written by Rita
Present Perfect Active: Rita has written a letter
Passive: A letter has been written by Rita
Future Active: Rita will write a letter
Passive: A letter will be written by Rita
Auxiliary verbs Active: Rita can write a letter
Passive: A letter can be written

by Rita

VWO

The examples

Tense Subject Verbs (prepositional) Object
Present Continuous Active: Rita is writing a letter
Passive: A letter is being written by Rita
Past Continuous Active: Rita was writing a letter
Passive: A letter was being written by Rita
Past Perfect Active: Rita had written a letter
Passive: A letter had been written by Rita
Future Perfect Active: Rita will have written a letter
Passive: A letter will have been written by Rita
